RSM has exceptional career opportunities available in our Risk Consulting practice for someone to join us as a Technology Risk Consulting (TRC) intern.

Our TRC interns are those seeking career growth and accelerated professional opportunities for an exciting, growing consulting practice. They are professionals who appreciate the ability to aggressively pursue their career goals while being provided the opportunity to experience a rewarding work-life balance.

Our clients depend upon effective risk management, internal audit, and governance of enterprise information technology in order to achieve their business objectives. TRC serves middle marketing leaders globally aspiring to help transform their technology risk management and assurance capabilities to be aligned to the key risks and strategies of their organization.

TRC professionals provide services related to business process and information technology controls for the various service offerings, including:
Consulting with clients on the design and optimization of controls utilizing a general knowledge of business processes, accounting, and information technologies. Create internal control documentation for the engagement including narratives, process and data flows
Consulting with engagement leadership and clients on strategic plans and other business matters, and help to anticipate emerging technology risks for our clients
External financial statement and SOX compliance engagements for application and information technology general computer controls
System and Controls (SOC) reporting and other controls opinion services
Technical IT controls review

Presentation and business writing skills will be developed from the very beginning, as a TRC intern you will be immersed in our culture. Our interns begin their career by being assigned mentors who will assist them throughout the summer. Also, our interns will have the opportunity to work as a team member on diverse client engagements across a wide variety of clients in the manufacturing, real estate, construction, financial institution, not-for-profit, healthcare, and private equity industries.

Position Responsibilities:
Demonstrate understanding of business processes, internal control risk management, IT controls, and related regulatory and compliance standards
Use problem solving and critical thinking skills to quickly identify internal control deficiencies, evaluate their risk implications, and draw the appropriate conclusions to best advise our clients
Perform IT internal audit consulting activities (internal audits over ERP systems, IT security, and other IT systems), perform external audit assurance activities, and perform service organization control services activities related to SSAE18 SOC 1 and SOC 2 reporting services

Qualifications:
Pursuing a B.A./B.S. degree or equivalent from accredited university
Major in Accounting, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, and/or related degrees
Minimum 3.2 GPA preferred
Travel to assigned client locations is required. Must have access to and ability to arrange for use of reliable modes of transportation to those locations
Strong verbal and written abilities
Strong multi-tasking and project management skills
Ability to work as an effective member of a team
Must possess a high degree of integrity and professionalism
Certification or working towards certification as a CPA, CISA, or CIA, preferred

We are PepsiCo

San Francisco, CA/ Palo Alto, CA

  • Exposure to Python or any other programming languages.
  • Good understanding of RDBMS database and SQL language.
  • Knowledge of ETL processes.
  • Knowledge with AWS or any other cloud technology.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Good team player.
Good to have:
  • Knowledge of Web Scraping.
  • Knowledge of Airflow, Kubernetes and Docker.

The Software Engineer Intern assists the Development team with tasks related to testing including writing test plans, software code, and testing scripts. This individual is actively involved in all phases of the software development life cycle and must communicate proactively and effectively with team members on issues.


What You’ll Be Doing

This position is responsible for translating business and user requirements into system tests; executing manual Functional tests; maintaining system test strategies; executing and programming software tests; and conducting technical discussions with internal development partners to understand their designs and intended output.

Software Engineer Intern include the following. This position has no management responsibilities. The candidate may be required to perform other related duties as assigned.

  • Individual may be given tasks/requirements in all areas of software development and support based upon project and scheduling requirements.
  • Assignments will be defined specifically with the intention of allowing the individual to develop independent software engineering skills in the area of software maintenance and new development.
  • Where possible, assignments will become more complex as the individual demonstrates the ability to accept increasingly complex tasks.
  • Tools Used: PHP, Javascript, JQuery, XCode (iOS) Android OS, C/C++, Cloud/VM, VB Net, C#, Visual Basic, Windows, Oracle, Perl, Linux, PHP.
  • Actively participate in product planning and other requirements gathering
  • Participate in special or customer-specific projects as assigned
  • Research and develop an understanding of the marketing requirements for the product, including how the product is actually used by CBORD customers


What You’ll Bring to the Table

Education Preferred:

  • Actively enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program in one of the following disciplines: Software Engineering or Engineering, Computer Science, or a Business Major with a Technical Minor.

Experience desired:

  • Less than 18 months of experience in development, research, and product testing

Competencies

  • Basic communication skills with the ability to work effectively in a team
  • Ability to work from own initiative, learn and adapt quickly, and be highly productive
  • Ability to create multiple “what-if” scenarios putting yourself in customer’s shoes and apply all the scenarios in the workflow of the application
  • Proven knowledge of the software development life cycle and solid understanding of quality software
  • Basic programing and scripting skills, preferably in an object oriented programming language
  • Ability to apply basic test strategy knowledge and methodologies to design, develop, and execute general software tests
  • Analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects under general supervision
  • Awareness of business issues as they impact overall project plans

position: Software Development Engineer Machine Learning Intern (Summer 2021)
description:
• Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline with a focus on software development and machine learning, anticipating to graduate October 2021 or later
  • Previous experience with Machine Learning (from university coursework, research project, internships and/or work experience)
The Textract team develops Deep Learning-based models to extract information from documents. The first step is OCR (optical character recognition) and handwriting recognition. Then, at a higher level, our Forms service detects key-value pairs in a document, such as the name, address, and phone number in a medical form. Our Tables service detects and infers the structure of tabular data, as in a financial document. Our R&D consists of developing better models that can combine visual and language information to improve the accuracy of the results. We are also working on self/weak/semi-supervised methods of training to leverage the large amount of unlabeled opt-in customer data.

  • Currently enrolled in a Master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline
  • Experience with Python deep learning frameworks like Pythorch/TensorFlow/MXNet or similar
  • Computer Vision background (e.g. introductory coursework)
  • Experience with Deep Learning (DL) basics and Computer Vision (CV) coding

description:
• Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline with a focus on software development and machine learning, anticipating to graduate October 2021 or later

The Textract team develops Deep Learning-based models to extract information from documents. The first step is OCR (optical character recognition) and handwriting recognition. Then, at a higher level, our Forms service detects key-value pairs in a document, such as the name, address, and phone number in a medical form. Our Tables service detects and infers the structure of tabular data, as in a financial document. Our R&D consists of developing better models that can combine visual and language information to improve the accuracy of the results. We are also working on self/weak/semi-supervised methods of training to leverage the large amount of unlabeled opt-in customer data.

  • Currently enrolled in a Master’s or PhD degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline
  • Experience with Python deep learning frameworks like Pythorch/TensorFlow/MXNet or similar
  • Computer Vision background (e.g. introductory coursework)
  • Experience with Deep Learning (DL) basics and Computer Vision (CV) coding

Job Description:


Vertica believes that each of us knows the work environment that makes us the most productive. That's why we provide our employees with the ability to work how and where they will be the most successful. We enable a flexible approach to work location, meaning for roles where it makes sense, you can work from the office or from home, or a combination of both, but you make that choice including where you choose to live. Vertica invests in the best technologies and provides flexible benefits and collaborative work environments to empower employees to work productively in the setting that meets their personal needs. That's why were so proud to have a highly productive and engaged team in every function of the company.


If you are excited about building great technology with a proactive team, you will find yourself in good company at Vertica.

We are looking for a Technical Writer to develop and deliver technical documentation for the Vertica Analytic Database. Vertica is a next-generation analytic database that offers extremely high performance and rich functionality at a low cost. We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic about becoming an information developer and who can bring new ideas and energy to our team.

Responsibilities

  • Research user requirements and design and develop user assistance materials for a variety of audiences, including end users, system administrators, internal support engineers, product developers and training developers.
  • Work with our documentation team to develop online documentation, quick start guides, tutorials/training videos, and blogs, with the goal of delivering an outstanding information experience.
  • Ensure documentation is accurate, clear, complete, and adheres to standards for graphics, format, style, terminology, and overall quality.
  • Work within cross-functional teams, including software developers, QA, support engineers, and product managers.

Education and Experience

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in English, Technical Communication, Computer Science, or other related discipline. Must be technically inclined and enjoy technical challenges.
  • Master's candidates and above also considered.
  • 0-2 years experience as a technical writer.

More about you

  • You have excellent verbal and communication skills.
  • You have a positive, “can-do” attitude and are passionate about contributing to Vertica’s success.
  • You are proactive and accountable.
  • You are enthusiastic about learning new technologies, including authoring tools and video-creation software.
  • You are willing to advocate for our customers.
  • You’re a natural problem solver. You seek continuous improvements and innovations and provide solutions when identifying problems.

Bonus points if you have experience with:

  • SQL, database, or business intelligence (BI) products
  • Python
  • AI and Machine Learning (ML) knowledge
  • MadCap Flare or other content management/authoring system
  • WordPress experience
  • Linux and open-source software
  • Jira or other defect-tracking systems
  • UX writing and on-screen help text creation
  • HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Web accessibility standards
  • Video-creation skills

About our team

The best ideas often come from fresh perspectives. At Vertica, our open-minded, diverse and inclusive team is always learning from each other. We approach intellectually challenging work with a "get it done" attitude. Vertica Engineers are given significant latitude and support to pursue what they are passionate about to make Vertica an even better place. If you are excited about building great technology with a proactive team, you will find yourself in good company at Vertica. Welcome to the family.

About our product

Vertica is a recognized leader in analytics powering some of the world’s most data driven organizations like Uber, Wayfair, Intuit, Cerner, and more. Our columnar, MPP, distributed database delivers unprecedented speed, petabyte scale, with analytics and machine learning functions built into the core.

We believe the future belongs to the fast. Join us for the ride!

We all depend on healthcare throughout our lifetimes, for ourselves, and our families and friends, but it is notoriously difficult to navigate and understand. As an industry that comprises 20% of the US economy we think healthcare should work better for all of us. At Collective Health we believe it's time for a new day in healthcare where as members we are informed and empowered to make the right care choices when the decisions are urgent and critical.

As an engineering intern at Collective Health, you'll develop systems that allow us to analyze trends, power our web portals, manage user data, process insurance claims, and keep our data secure. Our tech stack is a distributed system of Java and Node components with React based front end. Our infrastructure is based on Docker, Kubernetes, and Postgres. We've got a ton of interesting problems to solve around distributed systems, data analytics and predictions, system reliability, security, privacy, and more.

Interns at Collective Health are involved in every aspect of our software development lifecycle, including designing systems, writing code, and deploying to production. As an intern, you'll be assigned a mentor who will help you learn about engineering at Collective Health and help you grow and improve as an engineer. Our engineering culture is collaborative and supportive, and we value learning from each other. We care deeply about diversity and inclusion and have worked to build a diverse team where everyone feels respected and supported.

About the team



You will be working with a team of engineers that are responsible for the Employer Experience in Collective Health. It is a small dynamic team with a strong focus on data. You will learn to work with big data tools like spark, databrick in addition to Java, Postgres and Frontend technology. You will be part of a team that is responsible for transforming large volumes of raw healthcare data into easy to understand insights to help our clients make better healthcare decisions.

About you



We're looking for interns who are proficient in an Object-Oriented programming language, such as Java or Python. We prefer interns to have completed at least one software development internship before. We are looking for interns who are willing to learn, strive to improve, and excited to make a difference in health insurance in the US.
Collective Health is a technology company simplifying employer healthcare to make health insurance work for everyone. With more than a quarter million members and over 60 enterprise clients—including Pinterest, Red Bull, Restoration Hardware, Box, Activision Blizzard, and more—our technical and customer experience teams are reinventing the healthcare experience for forward-thinking employers and their people across the U.S.

Collective Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with additional offices in Chicago, IL, and Lehi, UT. Founded in 2013, Collective Health is backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund, DFJ Growth, PSP Investments, NEA, GV, G Squared, Founders Fund, Maverick Ventures, Mubadala Ventures, Sun Life, and other leading investors. About The Energy Authority
The Energy Authority is a public power-owned, nonprofit corporation with offices in Jacksonville, Florida and Bellevue (Seattle), Washington. TEA provides public power utilities with access to advanced resources and technology systems so they can respond competitively in the changing energy markets. Through partnership with TEA, utilities benefit from an experienced organization that is singularly focused on deriving the maximum value of their assets from the market.

SUMMARY
The Energy Authority’s Connected Analytics group is looking for motivated interns who are interested to learn how data analytics is applied in the utility sector and who enjoy learning in a collaborative environment. The Connected Analytics intern will provide support to the Data Engineering team within the Connected Analytics group. This position will provide the intern with opportunities to enhance technical, presentation and interpersonal skills. This position is for an initial 1-year term with an option to extend as skills match need.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

• Assist in the preparation of clean time-series data sets for Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) analysis

• Assist in the development of clean data-sets for analysis including Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) meta-data, buildings data, and other category or time-series data.

• Support the development of data pipelines using SQL, Python and R

• Learn the ETL process and support issue identification and resolution

• Prepare necessary visualizations to support the Data Engineering team reporting to clients

• Develop PowerPoint presentations to support the Data Engineering team presentation to clients

• As time permits, become familiar with TEA’s organization – front, middle, and back office - and functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
A student actively enrolled at an accredited university, a 3.0 cumulative GPA (or better) in major field of study, and demonstrated proficiency in analytical studies. Preferred areas of study: Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or Economics.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.

Verathon® is looking for an embedded systems SW Engineer Intern to become the newest member of our New Product Development team located in the Bothell, WA headquarters.

The SW Engineer Intern will broadly support the Research & Development team, including Advanced Technology, Systems Engineering, and Test Engineering groups on new product and technology development projects. The SW Engineer Intern will work as part of a cross[1]functional team in a dynamic environment. This position is an integral part of the product and technology development teams.

Principal Responsibilities:

  • Support advanced algorithm development for abdominal ultrasound imaging applications
  • Support development of prototype electronic medical devices based on embedded and PC technology
  • Support hardware and software testing for technology development and product design verification and reliability
  • Support special projects as necessary
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop advanced solutions to medical problems
  • Present and document findings from projects

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

About Verathon:

Verathon is a global medical device company focused on supporting customers by being their trusted partner, delivering high-quality products that endure over time and ensure clinical and economic utility. Two areas where Verathon has significantly impacted patient care, and become the market leader in each, are bladder volume measurement and airway management. The company’s BladderScan portable ultrasound and GlideScope video laryngoscopy & bronchoscopy systems effectively address unmet needs for healthcare providers and meaningfully raise the standard of care for patients. Verathon, a subsidiary of Roper Technologies, is headquartered in Bothell, Washington, USA and has international subsidiaries in Canada, Europe and Asia Pacific. SMS Assist is looking for a Product Manager Intern for our 2021 Summer Internship program!

The SMS Assist Summer Internship program is a full-time, paid opportunity that will run from June 8th –August 14th. An internship at SMS Assist will provide an opportunity to work with a fast-paced, growing company in Chicago’s vibrant technology scene. Each intern in our summer group goes through one week of training together as a cohort and are placed in one of our departments, where they’ll spend around 75% of their time throughout the summer. The other 25% is spent engaging in intern-specific activities and learning opportunities, such as executive lunch & learns, personal development workshops, and access throughout the company for informational interviews. During the internship, the program interns will work together on an SMS Assist business case and they will present their findings and ideas at the conclusion of the internship for SMS Assist leadership and other key team members. Of course, we have some fun social events thrown in there as well!

Job Classification

  • This is a full time, non-exempt position
  • The schedule for this position is Monday- Friday 8:00 AM-5:00 PM
  • The SMS Assist Summer Internship program is a full-time, paid opportunity that will run from June-August. An internship at SMS Assist will provide an opportunity to work with a fast-paced, growing company in Chicago’s vibrant technology scene. At SMS Assist, the internship program is about developing yourself while having a real, memorable, and fun career experience.

Core Responsibilities

The internship role will be in the ProdTech department.

  • Ability to collaborate with business partners and stakeholders to discover and articulate requirements and user stories, prioritize based on value and development effort, and deliver per customer contracts and/or requests with high quality and predictability
  • Ability to collaborate with customers, software engineering, operations personnel, sales and other product managers to ensure on-time delivery of product software features that focus on creating data-driven actionable insights that optimize customer facilities maintenance spend and improve operational efficiency
  • Strong systems-thinking skills for considering holistic implications of decisions, cause-and -effect, effective portfolio prioritization to support top-level business objectives
  • Translate business requirements into user stories for the development team
  • Translate technical capabilities, constraints and impediments to business stakeholders in human terms
  • Effectively collaborate with UI/UX, QA, Product Managers and Developers
  • Strong communication skills—able to make the complex simple; can describe technology in terms of business implications and translate business needs into technical requirements
  • Ensure confidentiality of internal and external data
  • Aid in the modification or enhancement of the internship program

We have two Product Management internship opportunities. You will be assigned to one of these two focus areas.

  • The Communications Platform product which involves in-portal messaging, texting, emails, IVR, and other communication methods

  • The New Customer and Integrations team focused on developing new features for Business Units, supporting features for new customer implementations, and developing the API platforms for integrating with external sources

Key Competencies

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills through telephone and email
  • Proficient with Microsoft (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Must be pro-active and have the ability to operate effectively both independently and within a team
  • Flexible and adaptable
  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects/assignments simultaneously
  • Working knowledge of JIRA a plus

Education and Experience

  • Must be a rising junior or senior enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s degree program in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines, or a recent graduate
  • MBA candidate preferred
  • Knowledge of Agile Scrum methodologies; Dual track scrum knowledge a plus
  • Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without sponsorship now or in the future (we are unable to hire on F1 or OPT visas at this time for our summer program)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
  • Traits: Attention to detail, critical thinker, team player, self-directed, and motivated

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

MITRE’s newly established Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Autonomy Innovation Center consists of a multi-generational, diverse team united by a passion and a sense of urgency to harness AI and Autonomy to help solve problems in the public interest. We discover, create, and lead through empowering an inclusive community of collaborative innovators, learners, and technical creatives. We are looking for people with a lifelong commitment to learning, who are passionate about harnessing artificial intelligence to make a positive impact in the world. We have built a supportive and inclusive environment where collaboration is encouraged and learning is shared freely. We value our diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives and harness these qualities to discover connections, solve problems, and create extraordinary impact.

Key Description: Join us for a paid internship that offers the opportunity to learn how to harness AI to address challenges that range from global health to national security. As part of our internship program Research Interns will not be cloistered in the lab, but instead you can expect to work closely with government and organizations in the public sector to invent and build AI-enabled solutions to some of the most challenging problems facing society. Ideas may come from MITRE’s internal research program as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the country. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new AI architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing to discover creative ways in which AI can have a positive impact on the security, health, vitality, and safety of the world around us.

*A pplying to this pipeline requisition will put you in a candidate pool that will be viewed and considered by our AI & Autonomy Innovation Center's technical leaders, all hiring for the same role across our departments.

Required Qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences or a related technical field.

  • Sustained excellence in academic performance.

  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including: C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python or similar.

  • Ability to obtain/maintain a US Clearance (U.S. Citizenship required). Security clearance or Suitability level may be required and may vary; applicants will be updated during interview process. (Because a full-time position requires a US government security clearance, we require our interns to be clearable even though they may not need a security clearance or suitability determination during their internship.).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in one or more areas of computer science, such as Natural Language Understanding, Neural Networks, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Privacy, Trust & Safety, Software Engineering or similar.

  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including: C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python or similar.

  • Applied experience working within technical fields ranging anywhere from technical health to national security.

  • Preference given to qualified candidates with active US government security clearance.

Internships are a great way for university students to learn about a technology or product they are passionate about while gaining practical work experience in a corporate environment. At Fujifilm Sonosite, we are committed to finding talented students who share our passion for medical device technology and this internship reflects that commitment! We have the opportunity, you have the talent! Read on to learn more about what we are looking for and if you think you’ve got what it takes to be successful in this role, apply today!

FUJIFILM, Sonosite, Inc . We are an innovative and high performance culture with tremendous opportunities. People who work here are given the unique opportunity to contribute to the advancement of healthcare throughout the world. Headquartered in Bothell, WA USA, Fujifilm Sonosite is represented by a global distribution network in over 100 countries. Since its inception, Fujifilm Sonosite’s lightweight, robust products have created and led the point-of-care ultrasound market. From sophisticated urban hospital emergency rooms to clinics in austere, remote villages, Fujifilm Sonosite systems are used by over 21 medical specialties and provide clinicians around the world with a cost-effective tool for improving patient safety and workflow efficiency. Fujifilm Sonosite holds a number of prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents.

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, small team environment with minimal supervision.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills

All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

#CB

Software Development Intern

Virtual Req #46

Friday, January 22, 2021

Iteris has been a pioneer and leader in transportation innovations for more than 15 years. We have had a long history of firsts in our industry, from developing statewide traveler information systems and connected vehicle technologies to traffic performance measurement and analytics software solutions. Our smart detection sensors – which can detect and differentiate between vehicle, pedestrians, cyclists and more – are used in one-third of all signalized intersections in the U.S. and are deployed in more than 40 countries worldwide.

Our 10,000+ customers, including state, local and federal agencies, traffic engineering departments, and commercial enterprise customers, look to Iteris as the “trusted advisor” for guidance on smart mobility best practices and ways to make intersections safer, less congested, and more sustainable and cost-effective to operate.

We are paving the way to the future of transportation and we want you to join us on this important journey.

Iteris is looking for a motivated individual who wants to help make transportation systems safer and more efficient. This individual will work within Iteris’ Commercial Vehicle Operations team, which is a core group of software developers, data scientists, designers, and product managers who develop software products, dashboards, and reports to help our public agency clients better screen, credential and enforce motor carrier safety programs. This opportunity is for an internship with the software development team in either Iteris' Idaho Falls location, or remote location.
What Makes This Position/Workplace Exciting:
  • Be immersed in some of the most challenging systems, at a national level to make a significant difference in roadway safety and efficiency.
  • Have a real impact as a member of a small team, working to solve problems that impact lives and convert your programming skills into tools to help travelers and agencies.
  • Work in a highly collaborative and agile software development environment, coordinating closely with teammates and regrouping through daily scrums.
  • Be part of an amazing company culture – we’ll look to you to bring fresh ideas and new perspectives to our existing products.
What you will be doing:

As a Software Development Intern, you will focus on resolving client requests involving application updates, bug fixes, or small feature changes. You will be responsible for testing and development activities impacting core products.
You will collaborate with Product Owners, Senior Development, and Architecture to align solutions with requirements and execute within scope and according to design principles employed in the CVO suite of solutions.


What you need to be successful in this role:

  • Coding languages: .NET, C#, Angular, MVC, Node.JS, .NET Core 2, JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, XML, AJAX, Relational database skills with PostgreSQL and/or Redshift (preferred), or MySQL or Oracle
  • Ability to work directly with Subject Matter Experts to translate requirements into specifications and code
  • Education focus in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or Related Field or equivalent experience
  • Strong communication skills are a must
  • Self starter
  • Must be able to work in a remote setting or in the office if permitted
  • Any hands on coding experience in web based applications currently used is a plus
  • Coding certifications, Azure, AWS certificates a plus
  • User interface design, interaction design, or usability skills a plus

What’s in it for you:

  • Incentive-based fiscal year-end bonuses
  • 401(k)/Retirement savings plan and match on day one
  • Comprehensive medical and dental coverage
  • Vision plan
  • Life insurance
  • Medical reimbursement plans
  • Disability coverage
  • Generous paid-time-off (PTO) benefits
  • Family-friendly programs
  • Comprehensive education assistance program
  • Home computer purchase assistance program
  • In-house training programs

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

    Systems - West

    Hourly

We are seeking a Software Engineering Intern (Backend) to join our team of engineers here in Austin. In this role you’ll gain hands-on experience with Node.js, NestJS and Typescript and help us build a new mortgage processing infrastructure from scratch. In our day to day we automate the mortgage process in the US to reduce the time it takes to get a mortgage. Our team is small and so you can make a big impact here!


What You’ll Do:

  • Help us craft software solutions to complex problems within the mortgage processing space
  • Develop, test, deploy, and monitor your code through all stages of the software development lifecycle
  • Be part of a team that is passionate about revolutionizing the mortgage process


Who You Are:

  • A junior or above pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly
  • Experience with a microservice architecture is a plus
  • Experience with Node.js/Typescript is a plus
  • Experience with AWS is a plus

Software Engineers at Citadel create next generation software solutions that help produce systems that power our investment research, trading, risk management, and funding & settlement systems. Software Engineers continually improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our investment process and reduce operational risk. Software Engineers partner closely with business leaders to develop and deliver software solutions that drive meaningful business outcomes. We build a range of critical solutions from pre-trade research platforms to trading systems to post-trade clearing and settlement services. These solutions include high availability, high throughput systems scaling to millions of transactions per second.

As an intern, you’ll get to challenge the impossible in technology through an 11 week program that will allow you to collaborate and connect with senior team members and our CEO Ken Griffin. In addition, you’ll get the opportunity to network and socialize with peers at iconic venues.

Your Objectives:

· Create technological tools that bring trading strategies to life

· Develop high-performance, large data research platforms

· Work in small teams to build the future of finance

Your Skills & Talents:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fields (Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD)
  • Exceptional programming and design skills
  • Strong analytical skills and familiarity with probability and statistics
  • Ability to communicate effectively in a collaborative, complex and highly technical team environment
  • Intellectual curiosity and passion for solving challenging problems using technology

Opportunities available in Chicago, New York, London

About Citadel

Citadel is a global investment firm built around world-class talent, sound risk management, and innovative leading-edge technology. For thirty years, Citadel’s hedge funds have delivered meaningful and measurable results to top-tier investors around the world, including sovereign wealth funds, public institutions, corporate pensions, endowments and foundations.

With an unparalleled ability to identify and execute on great ideas, Citadel’s team of investment professionals, operating from offices including Chicago, New York, San Francisco, London, Hong Kong and Shanghai, deploy capital across all major asset classes, in all major financial markets.

Hello, future Concord Group Insurance Intern! We’re very excited to welcome you to our team this summer! As an Application Development Intern, you’ll be joining a collaborative team of Developers in our IT Department. During your internship, you’ll receive all the support you need to be successful including on-the-job training and mentorship from our talented team members. You won’t just be job shadowing, you’ll be doing real work through a series of projects and tasks designed by our senior leadership team.

Our 12-week program is structured to provide you with a well-rounded education in the insurance industry and an opportunity to explore the many career paths our company has to offer. The goal of our program is to provide you with all the fundamentals you need to pursue a role with Concord Group Insurance post-graduation!

What you’ll bring:
  • A strong desire to learn! Our internships are designed to give you exposure to many aspects of the insurance industry
  • Critical thinking and problem solving skills
  • The ability to work as part of a team. Collaboration between team members is a fundamental part of our company values; we learn from each other, lend a helping hand when needed and share ideas in order to best serve our policyholders and independent agents
  • Proven organizational skills which will serve you well during your internship
  • Effective communication skills including the ability to present and share information, and report analytical findings
  • Experience with the XML, XPath and SQL is a plus
  • At least a 3.0 GPA and a study focus in the following areas: Computer Science, Information Technology, or Information Systems
What you’ll learn:
  • What it means to be a mutual insurance company and how Concord Group Insurance helps protect what matters most, from the homes and cars that families rely on, to the small businesses that help communities thrive
  • How our mission-critical Policy Administration Systems keep our business running smoothly
  • How to work as part of a team, with both technical and non-technical members
  • How to utilize Duck Creek Development tools to develop well designed, testable, and efficient code
What you’ll be doing:
  • Developing Technical Specifications for system changes and presenting specifications and code for peer review
  • Assisting in application testing
  • Producing and maintaining technical documentation
  • Helping us build an even better internship experience through your insights and feedback!
  • At the conclusion of your summer internship, you will present your work, skills, achievements and experience to our senior leadership team

Founded in Tokyo in 2012, SmartNews has quickly become the go-to source of news for millions of users around the world, and a leading news discovery mobile app in Japan and the US. Our mission is bigger than simply aggregating news, and we are working to break through the filter bubble and deliver the world’s quality information to the people who need it.

SmartNews is seeking strong AI/Machine Learning interns to work on US news ranking projects. The team pursues research & development in the areas of applied machine learning, with focus on deep neural networks, large-scale recommendation systems, NLP and reinforcement learning etc. As a member of the team, you will work with experienced ML engineers and AI researchers on some of the most challenging technical problems, develop new ML solutions that will impact user experience, and collaborate with the best product teams to integrate your ideas into our products.

Requirements

• In-depth expertise in deep learning and recommendation

• Excellent programming skills in Java, Python, Sql, C/C++

• Strong publication record and good communication skills

• Knowledge of common ML frameworks such as TensorFlow and/or PyTorch

• Creative, collaborative, & product-focused

• Expected to perform well in a fast-paced environment

Education & Experience

Pursuing PhD, Masters degree in AI/Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Science, Data Science, or related areas.

Benefits

Due to the covid-19 situation, the intern can choose to work remotely from your own place.

This is a hands on Internship opportunity. We are looking for candidates in MN or WI that are willing to work in our Hudson, WI office. Come learn how to design and build digital forms within our internal forms development tool. Work on a fast paced, entrepreneurial team where every day new opportunities and challenges arise. During your time here this summer you will have the chance to interface with the customer success and care team, product development team, and engineering team. This position will report to the Forms Developer Team Lead.

Hours

  • Up to 29 hours a week

Duration

  • We are looking to hire interns for the summer months of May-August. There may be opportunities to work beyond this time frame, but there are no guarantees.

Top 3-5 Job Responsibilities

  • Build forms using the internal forms development tool
  • Collaborate with other forms builders to improve the form building process
  • Assigning work from forms backlog based on priority
  • Making changes to forms after they are created based on customer feedback
  • Finding the most effective and efficient way to build forms

A Day in the Life

  • Select forms from a backlog containing forms of varying complexity and deadlines to create
  • Create a Tevera form based on the original form provided by the university, closely matching the structure and content of the original copy
  • Submit completed forms to forms management for review and approval
  • Make changes to the forms as necessary based on university feedback

What You Need to Succeed

  • Excited to work on an entrepreneurial team, responsible, honest, creative, and self motivated
  • Interested in Saas and software development
  • Looking for more experience working with clients on a project basis and want to learn more about how to use software to meet clients’ needs
  • Comfortable communicating with others both internally with coworkers and externally with customers
  • Proficient with computers

How we will help you succeed

  • We provide interns with opportunities for meaningful hands-on experience within Tevera including: working on a project, being part of a team, contributing to larger goals
  • Provide constructive feedback
  • We are committed to help interns get to know themselves better by providing training on personal communication styles and core motivations

Performance Reviews

  • Interns will receive regular feedback on performance or what areas they can improve

Job Clearance Requirements

  • This job requires a person to not have a serious infraction of security in previous jobs.

Tevera is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Tevera is a drug-free workplace

position: Embedded Systems Software Intern, Robotics Prototyping
description:
About Zipline


Do you want to change the world? At Zipline you will use drones to deliver critical and lifesaving medicine to thousands of hospitals serving millions of people in multiple countries. Our mission is to provide every human on Earth with instant access to vital medical supplies. Join Zipline and help us make this a reality for billions of people.

About You and The Role



As a member of the Embedded Systems team at Zipline, you will go deep in your area of ownership, becoming an expert in the problem domain, defining requirements for systems, rapidly developing creative and simple solutions, and proving with testing and data that the system meets the rigors and edge-cases of real-world deployment. Embedded Systems engineers also contribute beyond their field--reviewing schematics, building user interfaces, designing hardware in the loop test systems, and more.

Zipline designs and operates the world's largest drone delivery service providing access to critical medical supplies. Leading the way in drone delivery often means exceeding the capabilities of what's available off the shelf and as a result we are engineering the majority of our system in-house. Doubling down on the reliability of our systems and inventing new robots is a critical path to delivering to our next billion customers--people whose lives will be meaningfully affected by smarter, more equitable access. We are deliberately expanding our embedded systems capabilities and adding to the ranks of our experienced team to achieve these goals.

What You'll Do

  • You'll work hands-on prototyping novel delivery aircraft systems. Your team will be iterating rapidly to test ideas around aerodynamics, controls, and delivery for our next generation aircraft.
  • You'll develop software to run missions, interface with sensors and actuators, compute trajectories, profile mechanical systems, control dynamic systems, and more.
  • You'll test your software on real aircraft at our secret test site, and work alongside mechanical and control systems engineers to identify and fix problems in a cross-disciplinary setting.
  • You'll use and modify custom simulation tools to design and de-risk flight test plans ahead of time.
  • You will be mentored by a world-class embedded systems engineer committed to your learning and growth

What You'll Bring



Please complete this required challenge to apply: https://flyzipline.app.box.com/s/scnx6p86h1a6oevuqnpgdlyux8f1cp7z

We think this game will be a fun but unbiased, execution-focused (vs resume-focused) way of seeing if we're all a match for each other. See here for a sneak peak at what the game looks like: https://youtu.be/xPJ420mRD64 (you can fly a drone, drop packages, recover the aircraft, etc.!)

What else?:
  • You've designed, built and deployed electromechanical systems and robots way outside the classroom. Previous interns have built submarines, solar cars in the Australian outback, electric boats, rockets, etc.
  • You're comfortable working in C, C++, and Python, and have developed software for a real time operating system or embedded linux.
  • You have a basic understanding of kinematics and dynamics, and can use matrices to work with rotations, transformations, and trajectories.
  • You can work independently taking ownership of projects with ambiguous requirements.
  • Bonus: Experience with the Robot Operating System (ROS), Docker and/or Julia.
Reminder to complete the challenge here and submit the link to your solution to apply:

https://flyzipline.app.box.com/s/scnx6p86h1a6oevuqnpgdlyux8f1cp7z

NOTE: Applications that do not include a solution to this challenge will not be considered. This is separate request from the link to your own projects.

Please be sure to:
  • Download the zip sim
  • Write the relevant code
  • Zip your solution and up load it to a publicly available URL or Google drive (be sure to change sharing permissions to "Anyone on the internet with this link can view")
  • Then submit the link to it in the last field in the application below.
If you encounter any issues accessing the challenge, please reach out to zip_sim@flyzipline.com

Past Intern Projects

  • Build a high data rate voltage and current telemetry system that runs continuously in our RTOS using ADCs, I2C devices and GPIO interrupts. Test the system with unit tests and in HITL. Deploy it to all aircraft and ground systems in Rwanda, Ghana and the U.S. Build data analysis tools to check data across the fleet. Use this data to root cause tricky failures that improve the reliability of our fleet so that patients get life saving medical products when they need them
  • Rapidly iterate on the concepts for a new perception system, integrating compute modules and sensor prototypes to fly a proof of concept ASAP and de-risk key aspects of the approach.
  • Build a system to multiplex batteries between chargers, reducing charging times and operator fatigue. Iterate on the design and user interface with the engineering and operations team, traveling to our test site in Davis with a mocked up user interface to get feedback. Deploy the system into the field, allowing us to finally serve hospitals that have been waiting for medical products.
  • Immediately respond to, reproduce and root cause failures so that everyone can get their medical products when they need them
  • Find ways to make the codebase better for other engineers through every feature built, for example removing tech debt or cruft, adding debugging or logging tools, increasing test coverage, improving toolchains or build times, etc.

What Else You Need to Know


Zipline is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws or our own sensibilities.

We value diversity at Zipline and welcome applications from those who are traditionally underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this position but are not sure if you are the perfect fit, please apply!

position: Data Science Intern - Summer 2021 - San Mateo, California
description:
At Guidewire, we offer a combination of good working conditions, an excellent market opportunity, a rational and meritocratic company culture, quality software products, and a long history of careful hiring have allowed us to create an enviable work environment.
Our Machine Learning team here at Guidewire is responsible for building Machine Learning Systems and Tools that make Guidewire products more intelligent and helps deliver analytics at scale. We are constantly faced with results-oriented challenges in the areas of Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Risk Modeling and Operational Analytics. You will be working in a team of 10 of data scientists and engineers who hunt down non-obvious datasets and apply ML techniques to enhance more traditional insurance underwriting processes.

What will I be doing?
Guidewire is offering a 3-month internship in the ML team. The internship is designed to give an opportunity to work in a real-world business environment, and to take responsibility for a specific data project that has the potential to provide real value to our customers.
You will be hunting down data sets that have the potential to add lift to our underwriting risk models. Your task will be to look at data sources in a particular area, work out how to source and clean the data, and investigate whether the data can add lift to our models. Example of data sets that you might be looking at would be:
· Explore datasets for population and housing density – as high resolution as possible,
· Explore census datasets that could be predictive,
· Explore other fields in the Google Places API.
You will be mentored by experienced data scientists and data engineers, and exposed to advanced ML techniques and approaches to product ionizing data pipelines and machine learning workflows. You will be writing Python code, wrangling data from a range of sources and building models. You will get exposure to working on AWS including the Sage Maker ML framework.

Intern Requirements

  • Currently pursuing (or just finished) bachelors or master studies in a Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of: Python coding, in particular data manipulation,
  • Knowledge in Statistics
  • Machine learning techniques.
  • Ability to work independently on a project and as part of a team.

Other types of things that we like to cultivate

  • Curiosity based on genuine love of technology and analytics
  • Accountability based on an earnest desire to do what is expected without prompting
  • Kindness and respect for your fellow teammates.
About Guidewire
Guidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.

Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. More than 400 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.

As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 1000+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our Marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.

Guidewire Software, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to an inclusive workplace, and believe that a diversity of perspectives, abilities, and cultures is a key to our success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. All offers are contingent upon passing a criminal history and other background checks where it's applicable to the position.

Disability Accommodations and Guidewire’s Appeals Process. Guidewire provides accommodations to the hiring process to create a fair opportunity for candidates with disabilities to contend for open positions. Accommodation requests should be directed to (650) 356-4940 or Accommodations@guidewire.com. If things do not go as hoped, we invite you to use our appeals process. Guidewire promises to independently review any denied accommodation and any decision not to offer you the position. The appeals process is the same in either case. Within five business days of receiving a notice of denial of an accommodation, or receiving a notice of your non-selection for a vacancy, call (650) 356-4940 or e-mail Accommodations@guidewire.com to make an appeal. Guidewire will assign a new decision-maker to review the request and/or hiring decision, who will then notify you in writing of a decision within 10 business days.

Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet



We are at a transformational moment in our company journey - and we’re so excited about it. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture, and to accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our purpose is to help customers improve business performance with Dun & Bradstreet’s Data Cloud and Live Business Identity, and we’re wildly passionate and committed to this purpose. So, if you’re looking to make an immediate impact at a company that welcomes bold and diverse thinking, come join us!

​

We have exciting opportunities available for Summer 2021 virtual internships at Dun & Bradstreet! We are seeking self-motivated individuals that are passionate and curious about technology. Interns will gain valuable insight into a technology driven business.

Available summer internship opportunities include:
  • Software Engineer Intern: As an intern, you will help to code, test, and create features for the next generation of D&B user interfaces, applications, and mobile app suites. You will learn from senior engineers and work on team of experienced software professionals. You will gain experience and mentorship in the software engineering profession.
Qualifications
  • Must be currently enrolled in a four-year accredited degree program, and returning to the program upon completion of the internship
  • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field
  • Working knowledge/experience in Java, Python, C++ and other related computer languages preferred
  • Knowledge of web application development preferred
Dun & Bradstreet is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, genetic information, protected military and veteran status, ancestry, marital status, medical condition (cancer and genetic characteristics) or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Dun & Bradstreet and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please send an e-mail with your request to TalentAcquisitionTeam@dnb.com. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are made on a case-by-case basis.

Please note that all Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://dnb.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers and all communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.

Dana is a global leader in the supply of highly engineered driveline, sealing, and thermal-management technologies that improve the efficiency and performance of vehicles with both conventional and alternative-energy powertrains. Serving three primary markets – passenger vehicle, commercial truck, and off-highway equipment – Dana provides the world's original-equipment manufacturers and the aftermarket with local product and service support through a network of nearly 100 engineering, manufacturing, and distribution facilities.

Dana Incorporated is seeking to fill four IT Summer Intern positions at the Global Information Technology Center in Maumee, Ohio or Novi, MI. Each intern will be given one or two projects to work on during their internship. These projects will be within Dana’s Corporate Business Analytics, Strategy/EA/PMO, Security and IT Governance departments. At the end of the internship, the intern will deliver presentation to the IT leadership team.

Business Intelligence Analyst Intern The primary focus of this position will be to highlight how data, analysis, and visualizations are used to drive business decisions and strategy. The intern will work in partnership with IT mentors and business stakeholders to implement analytics solutions that support business strategy. The intern may also assist in projects to improve processes within the data analytics team. Students will be assigned to a specific project or enhancement and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on computer science, information technology, information systems, software engineering, and/or business. Strong analytical skills, exposure to data modeling principles, and experience with any reporting tools is a plus. Intern primary focus will be working on a Microsoft Power BI reporting projects and support. Students applying for this internship will need to have experience with the Microsoft tools.

IT Strategy / Enterprise Architecture I ntern primary focus will be to work in partnership with I.T. Enterprise Architecture (EA) leaders to define opportunities for improving processes and systems, reducing costs, and qualifying potential business benefits of a strategic I.T. approach. The EA intern will be assigned to several projects and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on computer science, information technology, information systems, engineering, and/or business. Strong analytical skills and self-starter mindset are needed. Exposure to architecture principles, Enterprise architecture governance processes, application portfolio planning are a plus. Experience with SharePoint and Microsoft PowerBI a plus.

Cybersecurity Operations Intern will need to be driven to explore and learn within the I.T. security discipline, seeing how security is an enabler for the business. Students need to have a desire to broaden IT knowledge of security concepts and practices. Students will be assigned a specific project and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on information technology and information systems.

I.T. Governance Risk & Compliance (GRC) Intern will work directly with the GRC Team to conduct IT risk assessments, analyze and aggregate the risk data, and report findings. The intern should have a desire to broaden IT knowledge of security controls, risk and governance. Students applying for this internship will work with all levels of employees within our I.T. Department enterprise wide. Students will be assigned a specific project and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on information technology and information systems.

Company Description

Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.

Job Description

::

Microchip is the leader in research and manufacture of high-reliability non-volatile Field Programmable Gate Arrays.

We are looking for a student who will work as a team member in Radiation Group on state-of-art Floating-Gate and ReRAM-based FPGAs. Technical tasks focus on device physics, circuit analyses, and system tests related to SOC Integrated Circuit response to Single Event Effects and Total Ionizing Dose effects.

  • Use HDL (Verilog) to design and test digital logic in FPGA.
  • Prepare samples for radiation tests.
  • Help to maintain and update the computer software for radiation testing.

  • Basic knowledge of Python, Verilog, R script
  • Excellent organization skill and attention to detail.
  • Effective communicator and creative problem-solver.
  • Ability to learn new technical areas quickly.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding, dynamic environment.

Lay the groundwork for a dynamic future with an industry leader. At Kaiser Permanente, you'll forge lasting relationships with colleagues across the organization while enjoying the opportunity to grow your experience and hone your expertise on assignments that have real impact. Our interns have worked on everything from analyzing financial software and developing new marketing strategies, to designing mobile apps and helping clinicians improve care delivery. We want you to get the most out of your time here and will give you projects that challenge you to think freely, question thoroughly, and explore deeply.


Project Description:


The Application Enhancements Group (AEG) is currently working on a large project (~$4M) to migrate all custom KPHC code from Visual Basic 6 to a web platform. AEG developers are very skilled in Epic and EMR development, but not currently skilled at web development. A computer science grad with web development experience would be a welcome addition to the team and provide the opportunity for a mutually beneficial experience. The intern could help our team establish web development best practices, while gaining valuable experience in Epic/EMR development and healthcare.


Essential Functions:

  • Contributing to a designated project or initiative to meet a KP business objective.

  • Report development and analytics.

  • Project management - planning, execution, and measurement.

  • Learning new applications needed to complete assignments or support the execution of business objectives.

  • Job shadowing in other functional areas.

  • Performing additional duties as required.

While COVID-19 continues to be prevalent in our communities, our non-care delivery staff are working on a temporary remote status and anticipate all 2021 interns will be considered remote workers. Candidates must reside in a market where KP is a registered and qualified employer.

Experience
  • N/A
Education
  • High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required.
  • Pursuing a bachelor's degree or have graduated with a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university within the last year.
License, Certification, Registration
  • N/A

Additional Requirements:
  • Aptitude to perform data and process analytics and formulating solutions
  • Proven ability to build effective working relationships as well as strong interpersonal skills
  • Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • 3.0 GPA or above
  • Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proven ability to build effective working relationships as well as strong interpersonal skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to learn quickly and experience producing high quality work in short periods of time.

The Innovation Team is at the core of innovation and emerging technology development, discovery, deployment and support activity. Our team is leading the effort to digitally enable our business. Our mission is to develop disruptive & innovative technologies and products that drive the evolution of how we deliver our services now and in the future. The key technology domains we are currently focused on include business process automation, data curation, industrialized analytics, machine learning & AI and scalable delivery platform.

A career with Innovation Services will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients' redesign, redefine, and redeploy their assurance and/or tax departments to be a strategic asset across the enterprise. You'll focus on assisting clients as they incorporate increased automation, machine learning, data & analytics, Open Source technologies into their processes to deliver better quality output and contribute more strategically to organisational decision making.

To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

As an Intern / Trainee, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:
  • Be curious and try new things.
  • Learn about how PwC works as a business and adds value to clients.
  • Think broadly and ask questions about data, facts and other information.
  • Support research, analysis and problem solving using a variety of tools and techniques.
  • Produce high quality work which adheres to the relevant professional standards.
  • Keep up-to-date with technical developments for area of specialism.
  • Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.
  • Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in materials produced.
  • Embrace different points of view and welcome opposing and conflicting ideas.
  • Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.
Assurance Innovation is developing capabilities leveraging the latest in Open Source technologies to automate and accelerate our client engagements across PwC. You would focus on incorporating the latest in machine learning, Big Data, NoSQL, cutting edge development languages, and advanced data processing techniques.



Job Requirements and Preferences:

Basic Qualifications:

Minimum Degree Required:
Bachelor Degree

Required Fields of Study:
Management Information Systems, Management Information Systems & Accounting, Computer and Information Science, Computer and Information Science & Accounting, Information Technology, Information Technology & Accounting, Computer Engineering, Computer Programming, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Management of Technology, Mathematical Statistics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Application Programming, Computer Systems Analysis, Computer Systems Analysis & Accounting

Minimum Years of Experience:
0 year(s)

Preferred Qualifications:



Preferred Knowledge/Skills:

Demonstrates some abilities and/or a proven record of success in the following areas:
  • Demonstrating ability to apply moderately complex mathematical or statistical methodologies;
  • Demonstrating ability to problem solving skills and the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks;
  • Demonstrating experience working with large data sets and deriving insights from data using various BI and data analytics tools;
  • Possessing an analytical mind with attention to detail and accuracy;
  • Demonstrating verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present technical and non-technical information to various audiences;
  • Demonstrating ability to interact with various levels of client and firm management in both written and verbal form; and,
  • Demonstrating ability to visualize and communicate analytical results.
Data Science:
  • Designing and building analytical procedures; performing unit and system testing to validate the output of the analytic procedures against expected results;
  • Generating reporting output of relational databases and SQL - including: NoSQL database models, XML and other database models;
  • Understanding development languages, such as Python, Java or equivalent and applying analytical methods to large datasets leveraging one of those languages;
  • Utilizing ETL tools and techniques such as Talend to map transformation and flow of data from a source to a target system; and,
  • Working with development, data analytics, and programming/scripting, utilizing Python, Java, C++, Scala, SQL, etc.
Data Engineering:
  • Building data pipeline with relational and columnar database engines; and,
  • Working with large data sets and derive insights from data using various BI and data analytics tools.
Software Engineering:
  • Utilizing Full System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Java, or Scala into projects to include object oriented design, continuous integration and standard development environment tooling such as Jenkins, Git, Jira, Confluence, Splunk, Databases and Representational State Transfer (REST) services, Web application architecture and technologies, and Linux OS; and,
  • Conducting pattern matching, regex creation and approaches to decomposing unstructured text, problem solving and learning new tools and technologies quickly and developing test plans, test cases and code automated test scripts which can be integrated with Continuous Integration (CI) processes.

Eagle Harbor Solutions is seeking an Intern to support various information technology and cybersecurity activities and initiatives.

Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:

Provides day-to-day support and assists with a variety of tasks in overall IT department function. Responsible for actively contributing to assigned projects that utilize current field of study in a corporate setting and work closely with a mentor. Actively supports day-to-day job duties, including working in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The Intern’s role is hands-on and supports the various information technology actions, creation of cyber-intelligence tools / methods and assists with research and analysis in order to mitigate and eliminate data and cyber security risks.

Information technology: day-to-day support for department or team including evaluation of technical configurations, validates secure systems to detect computer and information security weaknesses. Responsible for the completion of project deliverables which may include running various reports, tests, analyses, etc.

Identity Management: Assist in mapping business processes in conjunction with Unified Identity Management activity. Conduct CMBD and data validation across multiple service towers

Cyber Security: Assist with conducting triage of cyber security alerts to identify anomalous activities of concern related to insider threat. Investigate alerts using monitoring tools, and escalate cases requiring investigation.


Requirements

  • Student majoring in computer science, information technology, cybersecurity or other related degree program.
  • The candidate should be familiar with various information technologies including cloud services, virtual machines,
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and navigating the internet.
  • An enthusiastic and positive attitude with an eagerness to participate, learn, and ask questions.
  • Ability to work independently and with others on projects under the supervision of a supervisor or manager.
  • Excellent active listening skills with a willingness to ask necessary follow-up questions to ensure tasks are understood.
  • Strong analytical skills, ability to break problems down and recommend possible resolution, and attention to detail.
  • Ability to gather, interpret, and summarize information from multiple sources.
  • Adheres to best practices, policies and procedures of company as well as department.
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP/S, and related protocols.
  • Knowledge of Windows desktop operating systems required.
  • Knowledge of Windows Server and Unix/Linux operating systems a plus.

Working Environment & Conditions

This position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The workload may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, do simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress. The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits and all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment.
